section.title: Upgrading CMC and VSA to &kw-hos-phrase; 4.0.1
section.para: This document describes the procedure to upgrade the existing VSA and CMC version to the latest patch as a part of upgrade of &kw-hos-phrase; 4.0.1.

section.title: Upgrading the Centralized Management Console (CMC) Version
section.para: The following section describes steps to upgrade the existing CMC to 11.5.01.0099.1 version as a part of upgrade of &kw-hos-phrase; 4.0.1.

listitem.para: Run hlm-upgrade.yml which includes cmc-upgrade.
2. Terminate the existing CMC session and launch a new CMC session.
3. Click Help on the horizontal menu bar and select About. A pop-up box displays which displays the version of CMC, as shown in the following screen shot, i.e., Version “11.5.01” Build ”0099.1”.

section.title: Upgrading the VSA Version
section.para: The following section describes the prerequisites and the procedure to upgrade the existing VSA 11.5.01.0079 to a new VSA 11.5.01.0099 version.

section.title: Prerequisite
section.para: Ensure that you meet the following prerequisites:

listitem.para: hlm-upgrade, which includes vsa-upgrade and cmc-upgrade, has been completed successfully.
cmc-upgrade is completed successfully. (Refer to to upgrade CMC)
VSA cluster or VSA VMs are in a healthy state.

section.title: Procedure
section.para: VSA upgrade is facilitated by Centralized Management Console (CMC).
The patches that is required for upgrading the existing VSA version (11.5.01.0079) is placed in /home/cmc-installer directory.

listitem.para: Upgrade of management group
Individual VSA

section.title: Upgrade Management Group
section.para: You can upgrade each Management Group one at a time. Therefor, for multiple management groups, you must repeat the following procedure for each management group you want to upgrade.

listitem.para: Launch CMC and login to management group (mg).
Click Check for Upgrades on the horizontal menu bar and select Upgrade.
Click Click here to stay at current Software version link, a pop-up box is displayed. Select the check box on the pop-up box and click OK.

Click Use Local Media to apply the patches from local media. Now, browse the location where the patch sets are downloaded and click OK. In the following screen shot, the patches are saved in /home/cmc_installer/patch_for_VSA_11.5.01.0079 location.
In respective mg tab, click Continue to proceed to apply the patch sets.
Verify the patches that (namely: 45102-00, 45103-00 and 45104-00) are going to be updated. Click Install to install all the three patches.
Wait till patch sets are installed on all three VSA nodes. Reboot of VSA VMs happens multiple times as required.
Select the check box and click Finish to complete the installation. The patches are applied successfully .

section.para: In case you have individual VSA which are not part of the any mg, follow the below procedure to upgrade it to VSA_11.5.01.0099.

listitem.para: Launch CMC and login to VSA.
Click Check for Upgrades on the horizontal menu bar and select Upgrade.
Click Click here to stay at current Software version link, a pop-up box is displayed. Select the check box on the pop-up box and click OK.

Click Use Local Media to apply the patches from local media. Now, browse the location where the patch sets are downloaded and click OK. For example, the patches are saved in /home/cmc_installer/patch_for_VSA_11.5.01.0079 location (refer to preceding screenshot ).
In Available systems tab, click Continue to proceed to apply the patch sets.
Verify the patches that (namely: 45102-00, 45103-00 and 45104-00) are going to be updated. Click Install to install all the three patches.
Wait till the patch sets are installed on all of the three VSA nodes. Reboot of VSA VMs happens multiple times as required.
Select the check box and click Finish to complete the installation. The patches are applied successfully.
